PLAHIS Planning Application Reference: DM2018/01302--- Address: Mill Green Business ParkMill Green RoadMitcham JunctionCR4 4HT--- Proposal: Privacy Screening-	With regards to planning condition 4 the requirement for privacy screening to Unit 61 (Formerly T07) and Unit 67 (Formerly T14) is not needed because the windows at adjoining Units 60 & 69 have been moved away from the balconies to prevent the previous issue of overlooking. In addition, the windows have been positioned within sufficient distance and match the distances seen on the balconies below on the first and second floors.-	We have had email discussions with Sarah Buxton on 12th June 2018 and 31st May 2018 regarding this matter where Sarah  pointed out that there were a number of balconies which gave views through the windows to adjoining properties and she was happy for us to put forward the proposal to rectify this.Solar Panels & Smoke Extract Fan-	The previous roof plans (13611-105) already show the smoke extract fans and solar panels to the roof.-	The updated roof plan and elevations to have more detailed design information and to show lifesaving smoke extract fans located adjacent to lift roof 3 as requested by building control.-	The updated roof plan and elevations to have more detailed design information on the estimated locations for the photovoltaic solar panels.Brick Piers -	Brick Piers to be reintroduced to match original granted planning.--- Status: APPRET--- Decision: --- Date Decision Issued: ---

PLAHIS Planning Application Reference: DM2019/00718--- Address: Goat Bridge WeirSpencer RoadMitcham Junction--- Proposal: Removal of tilting weir and installation of Rock ramp, incorporating the existing tilting weir base into the ramp construction. The rock ramp is to have a minimum 1 in 20 to 1 in 35 slopes if possible. Reduce river width by installing soft engineered berms using site won material to increase depths and flow. Vegetation clearance to improve light penetration. Temporary compound area/s adjacent to river for material storage etc. Notches can be cut into the smaller weirs downstream of the tilting weir to improve fish passage. Construct several fish passable structures to raise water level to 23m AOD maintaining the current water level and driving head to feed wetlands. Also provide a controllable feed from wetlands to main drain toward Redrow Habitat pond.--- Status: NDET--- Decision: NDET--- Date Decision Issued: 22-MAY-19---

site_name: Former Wandle Trading Estate Development Site
description: Application to clear condition 10 (Contaminated Land) of approved application DM2020/01971.
application_type_full: Approval of details reserved by a condition (discharge)
decision_conditions: Each phase of the development as approved shall not be implemented until a contaminated land assessment and associated remedial strategy relevant to that phase (or phases), has been submitted to, and agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.Phase 1 of the development shall be implemented in full accordance with the remedial measures set out in the RSK Remedial Strategy Report September 2016 (ref: 2842 3- R02(05)) and accompanying RSK supplementary geo-environmental site assessment May 2016 (ref: 28423-R01(01)) as hereby approved.Phase 2 of the development shall be completed in accordance with details approved in respect of this condition (contaminated land) as described within the letter dated 1 February 2019 relevant to planning application ref. C2017/1219/CLC and with details approved in application reference CLC2020/00125.Phase 3 of the development shall be implemented in accordance with respect to the partially discharged details set out within the Phase 1 Preliminary Risk Assessment, prepared by Terrage Environmental Consultants as approved in application reference CLC2020/00125.Reason: To prevent harm to human health and pollution of the environment in accordance with the aims and objectives of Policy 34 of the Sutton Local Plan 2018.
